trigger_event: A confidential system alert exposes a critical flaw in the BCI during a period of public anxiety and unpredictable compliance score swings. The Council asks Oksana for an immediate solution before the audit.
dilemma: Oksana must decide whether to recommend masking the system’s flaws with a citywide, celebratory 'Festival of Compliance,' or to admit the severity of the BCI’s failure and call for an open digital shutdown, risking chaos but revealing the truth.
reason: Oksana knows masking instability may worsen mistrust, but exposing the truth could push the city into disorder—and her own precarious position as a known skeptic makes her vulnerable if she chooses either side.
choice_a: Recommend a masked Festival of Compliance, hoping spectacle will restore order and hide instability.
belief_a: Maintaining order, even artificially, prevents panic and buys time.
Surface unity is safer than raw chaos, especially for vulnerable citizens.
Spectacle can shape behavior and perception—sometimes that's necessary.
choice_b: Expose the magnitude of the BCI’s collapse, urging a full system shutdown and manual community order, even if chaos follows.
belief_b: Truth, even if risky, is the only way to rebuild trust.
Artificial order deepens society’s wounds and can’t last.
Only through shared vulnerability can citizens reclaim power.
